summary: The Office of Management and Budget manages a government-wide effort to optimize and consolidate federal data centers. In FY 2020, 24 agencies planned to close a total of 46 data centers—and ended up closing 96, saving $875.10 million. However, these agencies reported mixed progress meeting their goals to optimize their existing data centers (such as reducing the number of underutilized servers), due to technical and...
title: Data Center Optimization: Agencies Continue to Report Mixed Progress Against OMB's Targets
